tool_description: Creates new versions of existing files with change tracking, maintaining version history and relationships between file iterations.

file_id.description: Unique identifier of the base file

new_file_path.description: Path to the new version of the file

change_description.description: Description of changes made in this version

version_type.description: Type of version: major, minor, or patch

user_id.description: Identifier of user creating the version

merge_strategy.description: Strategy for handling conflicts: overwrite, merge, or preserve

auto_increment.description: Whether to automatically increment version numbers

preserve_metadata.description: Whether to preserve metadata from previous version

notification_users.description: List of user IDs to notify about the new version

approval_required.description: Whether the version requires approval before activation

retention_policy.description: How long to retain this version: indefinite, temporary, or archive

error_messages: File not found: The specified file_id does not correspond to an existing file.
Invalid version type: Version type must be one of major, minor, or patch.
New file path invalid: The new file path does not exist or is not accessible.
Version conflict: A version with similar characteristics already exists.
User permission denied: User does not have permission to create versions of this file.
Invalid merge strategy: Merge strategy must be one of overwrite, merge, or preserve.
Parent version not found: The specified parent_version does not exist.
Invalid retention policy: Retention policy must be one of indefinite, temporary, or archive.
usage: Provide file_id, new_file_path, change_description, version_type, and user_id. Optionally configure merge_strategy, branching, metadata handling, notifications, and approval workflow. The tool creates a new version with proper lineage tracking.

version_id.description: Unique identifier for the newly created version

status.description: Version status: active, pending, or draft

branch.description: Branch name where the version was created
